field.label: Enable
field.help: This will activate the Postfix daemon.

field.label: System Hostname
field.help: The 'System Hostname' parameter specifies the internet hostname of this mail system. The default is to use the fully-qualified domain name from gethostname(). It is used as a default value for many other configuration parameters.

field.label: System Domain
field.help: The 'System Domain' parameter specifies the local internet domain name. The default is to use 'System Hostname' minus the first component. It is used as a default value for many other configuration parameters.

field.label: System Origin
field.help: The 'System Origin' parameter specifies the domain that locally-posted mail appears to come from. The default is to append 'System Hostname', which is fine for small sites.

field.label: Listen IPs
field.help: The 'Listen IPs' parameter specifies a comma-separated list of IP addresses to listen to. Default is to listen on all interfaces.

field.label: Listen Port
field.help: Port to listen on.

field.label: IP Version
field.help: Choose which IP versions are allowed, defaults to all.

field.label: Bind SMTP Client Address
field.help: Specify the IPv4 address the server should bind to for outgoing connections. In most cases empty is fine.

field.label: Bind SMTP Client v6 Address
field.help: Specify the IPv6 address the server should bind to for outgoing connections. In most cases empty is fine.

field.label: Trusted Networks
field.help: The 'Trusted Networks' parameter specifies the list of trusted SMTP clients. In particular, trusted SMTP clients are allowed to relay mail through Postfix. Please use CIDR notation like 192.168.0.0/24 separated by spaces. IPv6 addresses have to be in square brackets like [::1]/128.

field.label: SMTP Banner
field.help: The smtpd_banner parameter specifies the text that follows the 220 code in the SMTP server's greeting banner. Default is "'System Hostname' ESMTP Postfix".

field.label: Message Size Limit
field.help: Set the max size for messages to accept, default is 51200000 Bytes which is 50MB. Values must be entered in Bytes.

field.label: Masquerade Domains
field.help: Masquerade internal domains to the outside. When you set example.com, the domain host.internal.example.com will be rewritten to example.com when mail leaves the system.

field.label: Allow TLS Only
field.help: Disable SSLv2 and SSLv3, only TLS allowed.

field.label: TLS Server Compatibility
field.help: TLS version/ cipher compatibility of the SMTP service

field.label: TLS Client Compatibility
field.help: TLS version/ cipher compatibility of the SMTP Client

field.label: TLS Wrapper Mode
field.help: If enabled it allows you to use SMTPS.

field.label: Server Certificate
field.help: Choose the certificate to use when other servers want to do TLS with you.

field.label: Root CA
field.help: Choose the Certificate Authority which signed your certificate.

field.label: SMTP Client Security
field.help:
• 'none' will disable TLS for sending mail.
  • 'may' will use TLS when offered (Opportunistic TLS)
  • 'encrypt' will enforce TLS on all connections. Please do not use this for Internet wide communication as not every server supports TLS yet.
  • 'dane' will enforce TLS if a TLSA-Record is published (Opportunistic DANE, RFC 7672). DNSSEC-capable resolver is required.

field.label: Smart Host
field.help: Set the IP address or FQDN where all outgoing mails are sent to.

field.label: Enable SMTP Authentication
field.help: Check this to enable authentication against your Smarthost.

field.label: Authentication Username
field.help: The username to use for SMTP authentication.

field.label: Authentication Password
field.help: The password to use for SMTP authentication.

field.label: Enforce Recipient Relay Check
field.help: If you enable this, every entry in Recipients will be checked against. When there is no match mail will be rejected. Be aware that it does not matter if the action is "OK" or "REJECT". This setup allows you to run postfix in front of an internal system and already reject unsolicited mail at the border.

field.label: Reject Unknown Sender Domain
field.help: This will reject mails from domains which do not exist.

field.label: Reject Non-FQDN Sender
field.help: For example senders without a domain or only a hostname.

field.label: Reject Non-FQDN Recipient
field.help: For example recipients without a domain or only a hostname.

field.label: Permit SASL Authenticated
field.help: Allow SASL authenticated senders to relay. Will also enable smtpd_sasl_auth.

field.label: Permit TLS Client Certificate Authenticated Users
Reject Unverified Recipient
field.help: Use Recipient Address Verification. Please keep in mind that this could put significant load onto the next server.

field.label: Delay Warning Time
field.help: Time until we send a notification to the sender if mail is delayed (in hours) - 0 or empty to disable.
